tweet: Broadband connectivity in many rural parts of the United States lags far behind that of urban and suburban communities. The bipartisan 2018 Farm Bill strengthens @USDA’s authority on rural broadband to ensure access is improved for folks in rural America. #RuralBroadbandDay

This is commonsense, bipartisan legislation that allows seniors and those on disability to receive quality health care in their own homes. Thanks @PQHH for your support! https://twitter.com/PQHH/status/1156308706839212043 …
@HumaneSociety thank you for your support of this legislation and tireless advocacy on behalf of our four-legged friends! https://twitter.com/HumaneSociety/status/1154456599311708160 …

Great bipartisan work happening in the Energy and Commerce Committee! These are real issues affecting everyday Americans and we are committed to finding solutions. https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1154406637345681415 …

It is high time that the US Congress put a stop to the harassing robocalls that are illegal and often used to prey upon our seniors! https://schrader.house.gov/newsroom/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=392593 …
Happening tonight! pic.twitter.com/t1sIvl3RUh

Our tour today is over. 

We are now meeting to share our initial impressions and ideas to help alleviate some of the hardships for migrants and how to empower the agencies on the ground in Texas to do a better job.

Our press conference will be streamed live on Facebook.
These images are being posted publicly and are available for media use.

This is a play pen for toddlers who came to the border unaccompanied. This is an unbelievable situation where horrific conditions are the first hope at a better life in America. pic.twitter.com/bhjrCVFlfx

I do not always have the right thing to say. But, I am a father to 8 amazing kids and I think of them. These kids here in Texas are so tough. They came to America with hope of a better life. We have to move past the partisan rhetoric and do what is right for innocent children. pic.twitter.com/xiSLNMDmkF

This is a beautiful baby that I just met. He was brought here by a man whose DNA did not match his. This is huge problem, men are kidnapping innocent children and using them to get across the border. This is bigger than political party. These are innocent kids and we have to help pic.twitter.com/wDo2J7ukt9
Men without children are being held longer. There are no facilities to move them too. pic.twitter.com/XNfQaXa5ei

Young men here are in bunkbeds. 4-6 to a room. I met a very kind young man from Guatemala whose parents saved up to send him to the United States. Life there is bad and there are few opportunities for young people.
Now touring HHS facilities where boys ages 13-17 stay. Average stay is 55 days. Longest stay in the facility was 600 days before reunification.
We are being told that there are two microwaves to feed all of the migrants coming through Port of Hidalgo. Some days there are as many as 2000 people seeking entry.
These images are posted publicly and available for media use.

*sound on*

We are heading across the bridge to Mexico pic.twitter.com/bfLOEFqtAP

Having frank and at times difficult conversations with the immigration officials here. I feel like they are being honest and straightforward about the situation here at Hidalgo-I have very grateful for their time and insight. pic.twitter.com/mCs0BF7qkL

Now at the Port of Hidalgo. 

This line of cars is lined up to come in via the Port. Many people are transported here by cartels for thousands of dollars. 

Folks are here for 24-48 hours and released to Catholic charities. pic.twitter.com/ZuQuDOACMk

It is snack time for the kids here at the processing facility. 

We are talking to them about what it is like here and how they are doing. 

This "pod" is for women and children. pic.twitter.com/Wov2lmjPqr
Here in McAllen, Texas. Having our first meeting with Border Patrol officers. This facility processes families only for 24-48 hours. pic.twitter.com/g2L49BDmq3

Our brave first responders do the unimaginable every single day. That's why I cosponsored the HERO Act which would help improve training for mental health staff and develop best practices on identifying, preventing and treating PTSD in first responders. pic.twitter.com/WdBQwyxKyF
Veterans and caregivers, join me in Salem on Monday for a community discussion about the newly enacted VA MISSION Act and how it will affect your access to health care. pic.twitter.com/ODivMTWg4z
Follow me here @RepSchrader for regular updates from my trip starting tomorrow morning!

This afternoon, I will be leaving for a bipartisan trip to our southern border. I am confident that our visit will result in real solutions that Republicans and Democrats can both support. https://schrader.house.gov/newsroom/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=392592 …
I voted this evening to hold Secretary of Commerce Ross and Attorney General Barr in criminal contempt. They should be held accountable for ignoring the lawful requests of the United States Congress.

Thank you to @FrankPallone, @RepAnnaEshoo , ranking member @repgregwalden  and @michaelcburgess  for all of your hard work! We passed 8 health care bills out of committee on a totally bipartisan basis. Now on the House floor! https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1151572009639403520 …

Huge bipartisan support for the Stopping Bad Robocalls Act in our  @EnergyCommerce mark-up this morning. It is time we stop these bad actors once and for all from preying on our seniors! pic.twitter.com/g2JuLiQ1AK

The racist comments made by President Trump about my colleagues in Congress are totally offensive and extremely unacceptable. I voted today in favor of the National Defense Authorization Act. This bill repeals the 2002 AUMF and allows Congress to reassert their war making powers after 17 years of war in the Middle East.

The courage and sacrifices of our 9/11 heroes must be honored. Today, I am proud to join my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to pass the Never Forget the Heroes Act, that ensures they get the support they deserve. #Renew911VCF

In a mark-up that lasted 4 hours, we passed 10 health care bills out of subcommittee on a bipartisan basis. Today’s work shows that there is indeed a bipartisan path forward and that there is an urgency to get things done that will help the American people.

As a member of the Energy and Commerce Committee, I am glad we took the important step in passing H.R 728 out of committee today. This bill extends advanced education nursing grants to support clinical nurse specialist programs. Nurses do critical, lifesaving work every day! https://twitter.com/EnergyCommerce/status/1149330794579734528 …
